_exec_summary.SummaryText: e Process Hazard Analysis are designed to improve the safety performance of the ammonia refrigeration process.  Foremost Farms - Richland Center expects to evaluate each PHA and compliance audit recommendation in a timely manner and implement, as soon as possible, those recommendations that will reduce the possibility of a release and/or mitigate the consequences of an unintentional release.

gement Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements:
- Employee Participation Program
- Process Safety Information
- Process Hazard Analysis
- Operating Procedures
- Training Program
- Contractor Safety Program
- Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures
- Mechanical Integrity Program
- Hot Work Permit Procedures

The Richland Center, WI facility has an emergency action plan that addresses the response necessary for a release of ammonia from the refrigeration system. Because of the pungent odor of ammonia, any leak is easily detected.  The compressor rooms are provided with ammonia detectors that activate if ammonia is detected.  The refrigeration system is designed so that major components can be isolated by closing selected valves.  Further, refrigeration system operators have been trained and are knowledgeable in the safe operation of the refrigeration system.  In case of a release that could travel off the plant property, calls would be made to the Richland Center, Volunteer Fire Department, and the Local Emergency Planning Committee to assist in the response.  Other state and federal notifications would be made as required.
5.	Five Year Accident History
There have been no reportable releases of ammonia in the past five years.
6.	Emergency Response Program
The Richland Center, WI facility has procedures in place to respond to the release of a hazardous substance.  Employees are trained to evacuate their respective areas in accordance with OSHA 1910.38(a). Coordination with the local fire department, approved ammonia contractor and additional outside emergency responders is initiated during an emergency.
7.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Foremost Farms - Richland Center expects to improve safety performance by emphasizing all elements of its PSM/RMP program.  All recommendations during th

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
1.	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Foremost Farms, Richland Center takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (detection systems, alarms, and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems and a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel.  All employees are informed of hazards in the workplace.  Employees who work with potentially hazardous substances receive proper training in the handling of those substances.  This facility has procedures in place to safely remove employees from areas in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance release was to occur, and to put in place emergency notification and response procedures.
2.	Facility and Regulated Substances
Foremost Farms - Richland Center located in Richland Center, WI is a production facility processing various cheese products. The regulated substance at this facility, anhydrous ammonia, is used in a closed-loop refrigeration system for product cooling and preservation in production and storage areas. To protect its employees, the public and the environment, an integrated safety management program has been established to prevent ammonia releases and mitigate the consequences of a release, should one occur.
3.	Worst Case and Alternative Case Release Scenarios
Off Site Consequence (OCA) data is available for review onsite at the Richland Center, WI facility.
4.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia Specific Prevention
